item.title: Introduction
item.description: What does fox do? # Makes is trivial to install a package form a GitHub repository even if it’s private. Fox packages are just GitHub releases, as long as you have read access to a repo, you can install (pretty much) anything you want. Fox installs packages to a specific directory /usr/local/bin/Fox/bin (on macOS and linux systems). It won’t install anything outside that directory. Trivially create your own packages. To add your repo to the available packages list, all you need to do is edit a yaml file.
